I was a kid in the 1980s. Big fantasy series in the 1980s were dragonlance and dragonbone chair. This fit that mold. The tropes are what drew people in. Jordan was a newer author. All he published before was some romance books and some conan books. Publishers were looking for stuff like this. Robert jordan said this in interviews. Start with the familiar and taje you somewhere else. In 1990, the end of the eye of the world was fresh. I read the book in 1990/1991
Also his universe the world repeats 7 ages. So its both in our future and in our past. We are their legends and they are ours. At the beginning of the first book Thom Merillion refers to us. Mosk and Merc fighting a war (moscow and america). Going to the moon on an eagle ( the eagle has landed) He has christ referencescat the end too. Rand goes, I deny you. Then the dark one goes Something like "fool do you expect to work?" It doesnt work. There is a faq on one of the jordan fan sites explaining alot of the references to myths and religion. The wheel of time is from Hinduism. Alot of the Forsaken are names from Norse references.
Return of the king they were at pallinor fields.
Jordan used the whole pattern thing to explain things he wanted to happen. I thought it worked well.

The Two Rivers is an Americanized version of the Shire. Goes in non trope directions after the first book.
This kind of thing was expected when jordan got published. He had to start here to go somewhere else. Btwm the idea for only femalr wizards is because jordan wanted to create a world where the womans movement took place so long ago that one remembers it. He mentioned this in an interview at the end of the audio of book 2.
In this universal time repeats itself. So the characters are both in our future and in our past, we are their legends and they are hours. Its why you have the king arthur references( there are more in future books).
Try the audiobooks. Male and female readers for male and female characters

I am in IT, I have aggresively job hopped over the last 18 years. During the 2008 recession, I went down in pay ( still above 100k). Companies offer salary based on previous employment. So you generally wont get a huge raise with 1 job switch. You need several. Also you dont want to exclusively switch jobs for money, to maximize income over time, you need to target jobs which will make you marketable.
This is a max you will top out at in your profession. Occassionally very high paying jobs come availabke. Those almost always are short term. They wont tell you that. Be careful with taking those. If you are out if work for few months it can cost you money.
Getting paid more also means being really good. It requires working on your skills outside of normal business hours. I also find reading technical forums and tech blogs from people who disect tech studf very useful. One useful thing to do is to ask alot of questions in a variety of tech forums and participate in discussions. There tend to be alot of trolls who are assholes to people who ask alot of questions. Once you get trolled your thread is ruined. I advise having multiple accounts so it looks like different people asking questions. Asking questions on a texh forum really helps speeding up learning new skills.
You dont need to spend hours every day working on your skills. The linger you are in the profession and the more you do, the essier it is to learn new skills.
Learning on your own us never as good as doing it at work. If you are in a dry position where your skills are stagnating, its time to move on. Only time its not is when the economy is slow( 2009-2010 for example), then securiry is more important.
I like to read IT forums on y ipad sitting on the couch.
I also recommend. 1. Periodically apply for jobs and take phone screens fir practice. Take notes on what you dont know. Yes you often get stupid questions in interviews, but you cant fight city hall.
2. You can always pass and say that you talked to your manager and you are no longer worried about being laid off.
3. When you pass on a job always either say you accepted another position or you are comfirtable where you are and that you talked to your manager about job security. Even if you hated the place. You never know if you will need a job.
4. If you dont want the job. Stop at the phone screen. Less likely if you apply again that anyone will remember you. Some people hold grudges if you pass.
The answer to the question about why you are switching jobs is I am worried about layoffs and just want job security. They are moving jobs to india, always works. Every company has layoffs so they get it.
